frameDefinitions: A Wrongdoer engages in a Misdeed.
In this frame an Evaluee is described by a (usually implicit)
An Experiencer feels bad about a choice, an Action, or a failure to do something, which they now consider to have been a mistake or wrong.
Words in this frame describe acts in violation of a legal code.
A New filler occupies a Role or serves a Function after the Old filler ceases to occupy the position.
frameExamples: You have <t>sinned</t> for the last time, Stephen!
That was very <t>righteous</t> of you to help him.
Smithers did not <t>repent</t> of his crime.
He was accused of <t><fex name='Offense'>hijacking</fex></t> a tour bus full of people.
listRoleDefinitions: This is the person whose <fen>Misdeed</fen> is being judged with respect to its morality.
The assessment of the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> is based on his or her <fen>Misdeed</fen>.
The time at which a <fen>Misdeed</fen> is performed.
The location where a <fen>Misdeed</fen> occurs.
This is the person whose <fen>Behavior</fen> is being judged with respect to its morality.
The assessment of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is based on his or her <fen>Behavior</fen>.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which is the basis of the evaluation of morality.
The role <fen>Experiencer</fen> indicates the person who experiences the emotion about their prior action.
The role <fen>Action</fen> marks expressions that indicate a prior action that the <fen>Experiencer</fen> has come to feel bad about.
The role <fen>Expressor</fen> marks expressions that indicate a gesture or body part which is displaying the <fen>Emotional_state</fen> of the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The role <fen>Emotional_state</fen> is modified by an adjective  that indicates the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is contrite.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> or the <fen>Expressor</fen> is contrite.
The illegal act.
This role denotes the person or entity that is badly affected by the <fen>Offense</fen>.
The individual who commits the Offense
The new filler of the <fen>Role</fen> that was previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen> filler.
The category that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities fit into as a result of the <fen>Function</fen> they serve.
The (generally desirable) state of affairs that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities are involved in bringing about.
The entity that occupied the <fen>Role</fen> or served the <fen>Function</fen> before the <fen>New</fen> filler.
The time at which the <fen>New</fen> takes up the <fen>Role</fen> previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen>.
listRoleExamples: The misdeeds <fex>of the previous evening</fex> were all forgotten now.
Sexual peccadilloes <fex>in the White House</fex> are one thing, lying before Congress quite another.
It was honorable <fex>of Jackie</fex> to give up the position.
<fex>Accepting that money</fex> was immoral of Lindsay.
His face twisted into an evil <fex>grin</fex>
They confessed and repented <fex>their actions against the Soviet Union</fex>.
Martha had a guilty <fex>conscience</fex> after selling inferior merchandise.
The police is investigating the homicide <fex>of Dr. Johnson</fex>.
The traditional thatched roof has often been replaced <fex>by corrugated galvanized iron</fex>.
What gas replaced Hydrogen <fex>as a safer medium for use in balloons</fex> on account it does not burn?
Oil and gas replaced coal <fex>in heating homes, in industry, and in transportation</fex>.
The electron was discovered and <fex>electricity</fex> replaced gas lamps.
When electricity replaced oil <fex>in the early 1930's</fex>, the steady beam was replaced by a flashing light.
